intro: Noccaea pauciflora, commonly known as the few-flowered honesty, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many familiar plants such as cabbages and mustards. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are alternate, pinnately divided, and covered in a fine layer of white, waxy hairs. Noccaea pauciflora is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to harsh, alpine environments.
